info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 12 at 6:28PM EST until January 12 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Cabarrus County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southern Mecklenburg County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southeastern Gaston County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... York County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 730 PM EST. * At 628 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Huntersville to 10 miles southwest of York, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Rock Hill, Uptown Charlotte, York, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, East Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill and Fort Mill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EST for the Piedmont of North Carolina...and Upstate South Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
